[[File:Mark Fisher - Withywindle.png|thumb|Map of the Withywindle]] {{quote|Tom came to Withy-weir. Down the river rushing
foamed into Windle-reach, a-bubbling and a-splashing...|''[[Bombadil Goes Boating]]''}} '''Windle-reach''' was a lower part of the [[Withywindle]] river beginning at the [[Withy-weir]] straight up to the [[Grindwall]].{{ATB|2}} ==Etymology== The word "[[Wikipedia:Reach (geography)|reach]]" can refer to any length of a river or to a level stretch between locks in a canal, but especially to "a straight portion of a stream or river, as from one turn to another"[http://water.usgs.gov/wsc/glossary.html#R General Introduction and Hydrologic Definitions] (Science in Your Watershed, U.S. Geological Survey). which is here the most probable explanation, as it gives a word-play combining ''windle'' 'winding' and ''reach'' 'straight'.See also: [http://www.glyphweb.com/arda/w/windlereach.html Windle-reach] (Encyclopedia of Arda). {{references}} [[Category:Rivers]] [[Category:Eriador]] [[fi:Windle-reach]]
